intro: Ryticaryum parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered ryticaryum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped, serrated at the edges, and have a slightly aromatic scent when crushed. Ryticaryum parviflorum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and meadows.
